When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |
$670$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{6}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$  
$670 \times 10$ | $\purpleD{6}$ |$\blueD{7}$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$

$\purpleD6\blueD7\greenD0 \times 10=\purpleD6{,}\blueD7\greenD00$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$70$| |$\swarrow\blueD{7}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$  
$70 \times 10$ |$\blueD7$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$

$\blueD7\greenD0 \times 10=\blueD7\greenD00$

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the right.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$6{,}000$ |$\searrow\goldD{6}$ | $\searrow\purpleD{0}$ | $\searrow\blueD{0}$ | $\searrow\cancel0$  
$6{,}000 \div 10$ | |$\goldD{6}$ | $\purpleD{0}$ |$\blueD{0}$

$\goldD6{,}\purpleD0\blueD0\greenD0 \div 10=\goldD6\purpleD0\blueD0$

So, $6{,}000 \div 10\neq 60$.
